content.text: <ide_opened_file>The user opened the file c:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Gemini 3 hack\rallycoach\src\app\page.tsx in the IDE. This may or may not be related to the current task.</ide_opened_file>

Error 1: Navbar shows "Dashboard" instead of "Log In" + "Get Started"
Root cause: The navbar component checks for an active Supabase auth session (sb-lrzzoqzwxqmqgdclnvdh-auth-token in localStorage). When a user is authenticated, it only renders a single "Dashboard" link pointing to /dashboard. The problem is that the welcome/landing page (/) should always show "Log In" and "Get Started" regardless of auth state, or the conditional logic is not properly distinguishing between the landing page and authenticated pages.
Solution: In your navbar component (likely in app/page.tsx or a shared components/Navbar.tsx), update the conditional rendering. For the landing page (/), the navbar should always show:

A "Log In" text link â†’ pointing to /login
A "Get Started" orange button â†’ pointing to /login

Instead of conditionally showing "Dashboard" when authenticated. If you want to keep conditional logic, it should check the current route â€” on /, always show the unauthenticated nav; on other pages, show "Dashboard" if logged in.

Error 2: All CTA buttons link to /dashboard instead of /login
Root cause: Every call-to-action button on the welcome page currently uses href="/dashboard":

Hero "GET STARTED" button â†’ /dashboard
Footer "Get Started Free" button â†’ /dashboard
Navbar "Get Started" (when visible) â†’ /dashboard

For unauthenticated users, these should go to /login so users are prompted to log in or register first.
Solution: Change all the href="/dashboard" links on the welcome page to href="/login". This includes:

The hero section "Get Started" link
The "Get Started Free" link at the bottom
The navbar "Get Started" button

Summary of changes needed in your code:

Navbar component: Replace the auth-conditional Dashboard button with Log In (text link to /login) + Get Started (orange button to /login) on the landing page
Welcome page links: Change all href="/dashboard" to href="/login" for the hero CTA, footer CTA, and navbar CTA

content.thinking:
Looking at the code, I can see:

1. The navbar (lines 120-143) already has the correct conditional logic - it shows "Log In" + "Get Started" for unauthenticated users and "Dashboard" for authenticated users. The user wants it to ALWAYS show "Log In" + "Get Started" on the landing page regardless of auth state.

2. The CTAs link to `/signup` for unauthenticated users, not `/dashboard`. Let me re-read:
   - Hero CTA (line 187): `href={user ? '/dashboard' : '/signup'}` - goes to /dashboard for logged-in users
   - Footer CTA (line 423): `href={user ? '/dashboard' : '/signup'}` - same
   - Category cards (line 236): `href={user ? item.href : '/signup'}` - same pattern
   - Arena panels (lines 330, 361): same pattern

The user's request says:
- Error 1: Navbar should always show "Log In" + "Get Started" on landing page, not "Dashboard"
- Error 2: All CTAs should link to /login instead of /dashboard

So the fixes are:
1. Remove the auth conditional in the navbar - always show "Log In" + "Get Started"
2. Change all CTA links from `/dashboard` to `/login` across the hero, footer, category cards, and arena panels

I need to update these navigation links throughout the component.

content.text:
All done. Here's a summary of the changes:

**Error 1 - Navbar**: Removed the `user ? "Dashboard" : "Log In + Get Started"` conditional. The navbar now always shows **"Log In"** (text link) and **"Get Started"** (orange button), both pointing to `/login`.

**Error 2 - CTA links**: Changed all links from `user ? '/dashboard' : '/signup'` to `/login`:
- Hero "Get Started" button
- Category cards (Tactical, Physical, Mental)
- Arena panels (Gear, Drills)
- Footer "Get Started Free" button

**Cleanup**: Removed the unused `user` state, Supabase import, and `User` type import since auth state is no longer needed on the landing page.
